meanings.definition: The phenomenon in which a mineral exhibits different colors when viewed from different angles.
meanings.sent1: The pleochroism of the gemstone was evident as it displayed varying hues under the light.
meanings.sent2: Geologists use pleochroism to identify minerals based on their color variations.
meanings.sent3: The mineral's pleochroism made it seem like a tiny rainbow trapped in a rock.
meanings.sent4: Her mood changed as quickly as the pleochroism of a crystal, showing different sides of herself.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the pleochroism of the mineral in a stunning painting, showcasing its color shifts.

meanings.definition: The property of having pleochroic crystals.
meanings.sent1: The jeweler admired the pleochroism of the crystals, noting their unique color changes.
meanings.sent2: Mineral collectors value pleochroism in crystals for their aesthetic appeal.
meanings.sent3: The pleochroism of the crystals seemed like a magical trick, changing colors before their eyes.
meanings.sent4: The pleochroism of the crystals was like a secret code, revealing different shades to those who knew how to look.
meanings.sent5: The pleochroism of the crystals was so striking that it mesmerized all who gazed upon them.
